forecast.name: This Afternoon
forecast.detailedForecast: A slight chance of rain showers before 4pm. Partly sunny. High near 56, with temperatures falling to around 53 in the afternoon. West northwest wind 15 to 18 mph, with gusts as high as 28 mph. Chance of precipitation is 20%.

forecast.name: Tonight
forecast.detailedForecast: Partly cloudy, with a low around 47. West northwest wind 10 to 17 mph, with gusts as high as 25 mph.

weather_report:
As the afternoon settles over Downtown San Francisco, a tenuous warmth begins to envelop the city, though it carries with it the cool breath characteristic of the area. The clouds, a softened marbled array, dance above, permitting glimpses of a muted sun that casts shadows on the iconic outlines of the skyline. A slight chance of rain lingers until the early hours, yet the air remains refreshingly brisk, stirring the leaves and whispering promises of more seasonal transitions ahead. Notably absent is the thick fog that typically drapes the Golden Gate; today it allows an unobstructed view of the bay, instilling a sense of clarity that feels almost rare.

As twilight approaches, temperatures will gently descend, inviting layers into your attire—perhaps a light jacket, or a cozy sweater paired with sturdy shoes for an evening stroll along the waterfront. Embrace the low-hanging clouds as they gather, hinting at the crispness of dusk. This is a splendid opportunity to wander through the vibrant streets, perhaps stopping by a quiet café or venturing through the varied neighborhoods, each illuminated by luminous street lamps. Tonight's gentle breeze along with a hint of chill will remind you that San Francisco’s charm favors those who venture out to meet it—an ideal evening for quiet reflection among the city’s secrets.
